client.databundle

Class DataBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.databundle.DataBundle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DataBundle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that holds all information that needs to be serialized
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • users

        A list containing all Userss in this system

        A list containing all Admins in this system

      • adminCreationRequests

        public final java.util.List<Pair<Admin,java.lang.String>> adminCreationRequests
        A list of Pairs, with value1 the username of the Admin to be created, and value2 the password of the Admin.

      • itemIdCounter

        public int itemIdCounter
        A number that is larger than all ids Item has in the system. It ensures that the id for each Item is unique.

      • meetingIdCounter

        public int meetingIdCounter
        A number that is larger than all ids Meetings has in the system. It ensures that the id for each Meeting is unique.

      • tradeIdCounter

        public int tradeIdCounter
        A number that is larger than all ids Trade has in the system. It ensures that the id for each Trade is unique.

      • minLendBorrowDifference

        public int minLendBorrowDifference
        The minimum difference between number of lending and borrowing of a user.

      • maxMeetingEdits

        public int maxMeetingEdits
        The maximum number of time a meeting can be edited by a user.

      • maxIncompleteTrade

        public int maxIncompleteTrade
        The maximum number of incomplete trade a user can have.

      • maxWeeklyTransaction

        public int maxWeeklyTransaction
        The maximum number of trade a user can have in a week.

      • maxMeetingLateTime

        public int maxMeetingLateTime
        The maximum number of day user have to confirm meeting occurred before the meeting is marked as late.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataBundle

        public DataBundle()
        Create a new DataBundle. This is used when the program runs for the first time and data is missing.
